intro: Comesperma pallidum, commonly known as the pale comesperma, is a flowering plant native to Australia. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale yellow flowers and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. It typically grows in sandy or rocky soils in coastal areas. Comesperma pallidum is often found in heathlands and is adapted to withstand dry conditions.
